intro: Micrampelis lanata, commonly known as the woolly climbing plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Micrampelis lanata is often found climbing on trees or shrubs in its natural habitat.
